page.title: List of surviving veterans of the Spanish Civil War

revision.comment: /* Nationalist forces – 10 veterans */ Fixed link for A. D. de Rábago
revision.text:
{{short description|Wikimedia list article}} The following is a list of '''known surviving [[veteran]]s of the [[Spanish Civil War]]''' (17 July 1936 – 1 April 1939). The total number of participating personnel is unknown, but an estimated 35,000 foreigners fought on the Republican side in what was known as the [[International Brigades]]. In addition, [[Adolf Hitler]] of Nazi Germany sent as many as 20,000 soldiers (not all at the same time) and [[Benito Mussolini]] of Italy sent as many as 60,000 soldiers to fight alongside the soldiers of Spanish General [[Francisco Franco]]. Veterans, for this purpose, are defined as people who were members of the armed forces of one of the combatant forces up to and including the date recognized as the end of the War, which was 1 April 1939. ==Republican forces – 39 veterans== {| cellpadding=2 cellspacing=0 border=1 style="border-collapse:collapse; border: 1px #555 solid;" class="sortable" |- bgcolor="#ccccff" !colspan=1 width="10%"|Nationality !colspan=1 width="14%"|Name !colspan=1 width="12%"|Date of Birth !colspan=1 width="5%"|Age !colspan=1 width="10%"|Residence !colspan=1 width="16%"|Force served !colspan=1 width="43%"|Notes |- |[[France]]||Almudéver, Vincent||{{dts|format=dmy|1917|07|06}}||{{age|1917|07|06}}||France||[[Unified Socialist Youth]]||Brother of Joseph. Joined in 1936. Fought at Majadahonda and [[Battle of Ebro|Ebro]].{{cite magazine|url=http://www.international-brigades.org.uk/sites/default/files/IBMT2-13Web.pdf|magazine=¡NO PASARÁN!|publisher=International Brigade Memorial Trust|page=7|title=Record attendance at annual Battle of Jarama weekend|year=2018|issue=35|author=Fraser, Pauline|accessdate=21 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.ladepeche.fr/article/2017/07/22/2616299-les-100-ans-de-vincent-almudever.html|title=Les 100 ans de Vincent Almudever|language=French|publisher=La Dépêche du Midi|date=22 July 2017|accessdate=21 April 2019}}{{cite web|url=http://www.acer-aver.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=675:hommage-rendu-a-valencia-aux-freres-almudever&catid=37&Itemid=141|title=Hommage rendu à Valencia aux frères Almudever|language=French|date=29 April 2016|website=acer.aver.fr|accessdate=21 April 2019}} |- |[[Spain]]||Arriaga, Gregorio Urionaguena||{{dts|format=dmy|1917|03|21}}||{{age|1917|03|21}}||Spain||[[Euzko Gudarostea]]||Mechanic before the war. Served in the Eusko Indarra Battalion of the [[Basque Nationalist Action|ANV]]. Witnessed the bombings of [[Bombing of Durango|Durango]] and [[Bombing of Guernica|Guernica]].{{cite news|url=http://mugalari.info/2018/03/12/gudari-durangues-del-batallon-eusko-indarra-anv-gregorio-urionaguena-celebra-101-anos-saludables/|title=The gudari durangués of the battalion Eusko Indarra of ANV, Gregorio Urionaguena, celebrates 101 healthy years|author=Gorriti, Iban|date=12 March 2018|publisher=Mugalari Kultura|accessdate=22 April 2019}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jjggbizkaia.eus/fitxategiak/JJGG/deiadarra/eventos/documentos/azken%20batailoia%20mauro%20saravia%20BAJA.pdf?hash=529f43f5a8630d62057980b08a9e3312|title=AZKEN BATAILOIA: EL ÚLTIMO BATALLÓN|author=Belles, Mauro Saravia|language=Spanish}}{{cite web|url=http://mugalari.info/2019/09/03/gudari-durangues-urionaguena-los-otros-11-soldados-vivos-del-lehendakari-aguirre/|title=El gudari durangués Urionaguena y los otros soldados vivos de Aguirre|date=3 September 2019|publisher=Mugalari Kultura|author=Gorriti, Iban|language=Spanish|accessdate=4 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Astobiza, Juan José||||||Spain||Euzko Gudarostea||Joined the Martiartu battalion of the [[Basque Nationalist Party|PNV]]. |- |Spain||Belda, Maria "Rosariet" Rosario Llin||1922||||Spain||Spanish Republican volunteers||Served in as a volunteer nurse at the Ontinyent military hospital.{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/cultura/2019/02/26/actualidad/1551171907_654454.html|title=Las brigadistas judías en la Guerra Civil: de España, rumbo a la tragedia europea|date=3 March 2019|author=Mantilla, Jesus Ruiz|publisher=El Pais|accessdate=31 August 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.elmundo.es/comunidad-valenciana/2016/04/24/571bafa4ca4741ab208b4660.html|title=¿Los 'ángeles' de Ontinyent?|language=Spanish|publisher=El Mundo|accessdate=31 August 2019}} |- |Spain||Borrellas, Ramon Barons||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|02|25}}||{{age|1920|02|25}}||Spain||[[Spanish Republican Army]]||Served in the 224th Battalion. Fought at the [[Battle of Ebro|Ebro]]. Lives in Cardona.{{cite news|url=https://www.ara.cat/cultura/Lleva-del-Bibero-generacio-apaga_0_2277372294.html|title=La Lleva del Biberó, una generació que s’apaga|language=Spanish|date=25 July 2019|publisher=[[Ara (newspaper)|Ara]]|accessdate=25 April 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www2.memoria.cat/llevadelbibero/entrevistes-a-biberons-supervivents-del-bages-any-2019/|title=ENTREVISTES A “BIBERONS” SUPERVIVENTS DEL BAGES (any 2019)|trans-title=INTERVIEWS IN “BIBERONS” SURVIVAL OF BAGES (year 2019)|publisher=l’Associació Memòria i Història de Manresa|language=Catalan|accessdate=5 March 2020}} |- |Spain||{{Interlanguage link|Bruguera, Juan Mariné|ca|Juan Mariné Bruguera}}||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|12|31}}||{{age|1920|12|31}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||"La quinta del biberón" fighter. Called up in 1938. Served on the [[Battle of the Segre|Segre]]. Became a film maker after the war.{{cite news|url=https://www.eldiario.es/eldiarioex/sociedad/Juan-Marine-cineasta-entierro-Durruti_0_735277570.html|title=Juan Mariné, el cineasta que rodó el entierro de Durruti: "El cine me ha ayudado a seguir viviendo hasta hoy"|language=Spanish|publisher=El Diario|author=Conde, Jesús|date=1 January 2018|accessdate=23 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.publico.es/culturas/cine-juan-marine-hombre-filmo-entierro-durruti.html|title=Juan Mariné, el hombre que filmó el entierro de Durruti|date=4 September 2017|language=Spanish|accessdate=20 April 2019|publisher=Público|author=Grodira, Fermín}} |- |Spain||Canet Català, Andreu ||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|11|30}}||{{age|1920|11|30}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Enlisted in 1938 and joined the 224th Brigade. Served at [[Balaguer Offensive|Balaguer]] and [[Battle of Ebro|Ebro]]. Lives in Cardedeu.{{cite web|url=https://www.elnasdecardedeu.cat/169-andreu-canet-catala-un-bibero-a-cardedeu/|title=Andreu Canet Català, un "biberó" a Cardedeu|author=Navarro, Xavier|publisher=El NAS de Cardedeu|language=Catalan|date=8 March 2017|accessdate=31 August 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.diarimes.com/es/noticias/terres_l_ebre/2019/07/25/81_anys_la_batalla_l_ebre_quatre_supervivents_les_llicons_del_dialeg_la_unitat_pendents_65911_3024.html|title=81 años de la Batalla del Ebre: cuatro supervivientes y las lecciones del diálogo y la unidad pendientes|date=25 July 2019|publisher=Agència Catalana de Notícies|agency=Diari Més|accessdate=31 August 2019}} |- |Spain||Colom, Tomàs Dalmau||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|06|06}}||{{age|1920|06|06}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Fought on the Segre Front. Lives in Manresa.{{cite news|url=https://www.regio7.cat/manresa/2018/12/01/tinent-rebre-bienvenidos-espana-franco/513204.html|title="Un tinent ens va rebre un a un: 'Bienvenidos a la España de Franco'"|language=Spanish|author=Mañé, Pepa|publisher=Regio7date=30 November 2018|accessdate=1 September 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.naciodigital.cat/manresa/noticia/80010/manresa/bages/fan/sentit/emotiu/homenatge/lleva/bibero|title=Manresa and the Bages make a sense and emotional tribute to the Camí del Biberó|publisher=Nació Digital|language=Spanish|date=2 December 2018|accessdate=1 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Darbra, Miquel Morera||{{dts|format=dmy|1922|04|26}}||{{age|1922|04|26}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Joined in 1936 with his father. Served at [[Battle of Teruel|Teruel]], [[Battle of Ebro|Ebro]], and [[Battle of Valsequillo|Valsequillo]].{{cite news|url=http://www.catalannews.com/society-science/item/some-students-don-t-even-know-who-franco-was-says-97-year-old-civil-war-veteran|title=‘Some students don’t even know who Franco was’ says 97-year-old Civil War veteran|publisher=Catalan News|date=20 July 2017|author=Terol, Alan Ruiz|accessdate=31 August 2019}} |- |Spain||Diaz, Alejandro del Amo||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|07|09}}||{{age|1920|07|09}}||Spain||Euzko Gudarostea||Joined the Meabe battalion of the JSU.{{cite news|url=http://mugalari.info/2018/06/18/reclaman-mas-compromiso-e-implicacion-institucional-la-memoria-historica-artxanda/|title=Reclaman en Artxanda "más implicación institucional" con la memoria histórica|publisher=Mugalari Kultura|language=Spanish|date=18 June 2018|accessdate=22 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=http://mugalari.info/2018/04/09/uno-durango-%C2%B7-buscamos-los-ultimos-gudaris-milicianos-mantienen-vivo-eusko-gudarostea-1936/|title=UNO ES DE DURANGO · Buscamos a los últimos gudaris y milicianos que mantienen vivo el Eusko Gudarostea de 1936|publisher=Mugalari Kultura|author=Gorriti, Iban|language=Spanish|date=18 June 2018|accessdate=22 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Esparraguera, Santos Cortés||{{dts|format=dmy|1921|03|10}}||{{age|1921|03|10}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Joined the 70th Brigade in 1936. Fought at [[Siege of Madrid|Madrid]], [[Battle of Jarama|Jarama]], [[Battle of Guadalajara|Guadalajara]], [[Battle of Brunete|Brunete]], and [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]].{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/ccaa/2018/03/04/madrid/1520181824_497479.html|language=Spanish|publisher=El Pais|title=La batalla del Jarama hasta el último detalle|date=4 March 2018|author=Serrato, Fran|accessdate=24 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.publico.es/politica/batalla-jarama-ii-guerra-mundial.html|title=De la batalla del Jarama a la II Guerra Mundial|publisher=Diario Público|date=26 February 2017|author=Campelo, Patricia|accessdate=25 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Ernabide, Ignacio||{{dts|format=dmy|1917|02|01}}||{{age|1917|02|01}}||Spain||Euzko Gudarostea||Joined the Loiola battalion of the PNV. Served as an instructor due prior weapon experience before the war. Fought at [[Villarreal Offensive|Villarreal]]. |- |Spain||Fainé, Miquel Pecanins||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|12|13}}||{{age|1920|12|13}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Called to service in 1938. Built pontoon bridges at [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]]. |- |Spain||Gallart, Simó||1920||||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||"La quinta del biberón" fighter. Joined at 18 years old. Fought at [[Battle of the Segre|Segre]] and [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]].{{cite news|url=https://www.lavanguardia.com/lacontra/20190330/461329338392/los-politicos-viven-con-la-espalda-tiesa-no-me-fio.html|title=Simó Gallart, superviviente de la Guerra Civil y de la posguerra militar|author=Amela, Víctor M.|publisher=La Vanguardia|date=30 March 2019|accessdate=24 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Gallego-Nicasio, Manuel||{{dts|format=dmy|1917|02|17}}||{{age|1917|02|17}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||"La quinta del biberón" fighter. Affiliated with [[PSOE]].{{cite web| url=https://herencia.net/2017-02-22-manuel-gallego-nicasio-cien-anos-cuenta-historia-nuevatribuna/|title= Manuel Gallego-Nicasio, cien años, cuenta su historia en NuevaTribuna.es}} |- |Spain||Iglesias, Mateo Balbuena||{{dts|format=dmy|1913|09|21}}||{{age|1913|09|13}}||Spain||Euzko Gudarostea
Spanish Republican Army||Participated in the [[Asturian miners' strike of 1934|Strike of 1934]]. Joined the Leandro Carro battalion of the [[Communist Party of Spain|PCE]] in 1936. Fought at [[Villarreal Offensive|Álava]], [[Biscay Campaign|Biscay]], and [[Battle of Bilbao|Bilbao]]. Later made a lieutenant in the Republican Army. Became a writer after the war.{{cite news|url=https://www.deia.eus/2018/03/12/bizkaia/llodio-nervion/el-teniente-escritor|title=Mateo Balbuena, el teniente escritor|publisher=Deia|author=Martín, Susana|language=Spanish|date=12 March 2018|accessdate=22 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.deia.eus/2016/05/29/sociedad/historias-de-los-vascos/el-republicano-centenario-que-todavia-publica-libros|title=Mateo Balbuena, el republicano centenario que todavía publica libros|publisher=Deia|author=Gorriti, Iban|language=Spanish|date=29 May 2016|accessdate=22 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Lapuente, Alfons Cànovas||{{dts|format=dmy|1917|11|04}}||{{age|1917|11|04}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Trained with his brother [[:ca:Antoni Cànovas i Lapuente|Antoni]] to participate in the [[People's Olympiad]]. Event was cancelled following the outbreak of the Civil War and the brothers enlisted in the Republican Army. Fought on the Aragon front. Later became president of the [[CN Atlètic-Barceloneta]].[https://www.theguardian.com/world/gallery/2016/jul/18/survivors-of-the-spanish-civil-war-80-years-on-in-pictures Survivors of the Spanish civil war 80 years on – in pictures]{{cite news|url=https://www.ara.cat/cultura/Mor-Antoni-Canovas-Olimpiada-Popular_0_2066793381.html|title=Mor Antoni Cànovas, combatent antifeixista i participant a l'Olimpíada Popular del 1936|author=Juanico, Núria|date=9 August 2017|publisher=[[Ara (newspaper)|Ara]]|accessdate=13 August 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.enciclopedia.cat/EC-EEC-1535.xml|title=Alfons Cánovas Lapuente|publisher=Enciclopèdia.cat}} |- |Spain||Martikorena, Gabriel Nogues||1920||||||Euzko Gudarostea|| |- |France||{{Interlanguage link|Mateu, Joseph Eduard Almudéver|ca|Josep Almudéver Mateu}}||{{dts|format=dmy|1919|07|30}}||{{age|1919|07|30}}||France||International Brigades
Spanish Republican Army||Brother of Vincent. Joined a militia in 1936. Entered the [[CXXIX International Brigade|129th Brigade]] in 1938. In 2016, declared ''embassador'' by Valencia's Government during the October 9th Awards.{{cite web|url=http://mundoobrero.es/pl.php?id=6925|title=José Almudéver Mateu: "El fascismo procede directamente de la decadencia del capitalismo"|website=mundoobrero.es|accessdate=14 August 2017}}{{cite news|url=https://www.ladepeche.fr/article/2018/09/13/2867747-le-dernier-brigadiste-europeen-temoigne-pour-l-histoire.html|title=Guerre d'Espagne : le dernier survivant européen des Brigades internationales vit en Ariège|language=French|publisher=La Dépêche du Midi|date=13 September 2018|accessdate=21 April 2019}}{{cite web|url=http://www.kfsr.info/2017/02/jose-almudever-97-the-anti-fascist-veteran-looks-at-the-battles-he-fought-during-the-spanish-civil-war-and-the-global-fight-against-the-right-wing-today/|title=Jose Almudéver (97), the anti-fascist veteran looks at the battles he fought during the Spanish Civil War and the global fight against the right wing today.|date=8 February 2017|publisher=Kämpfer und Freunde der Spanischen Republik 1936–1939 e. V. (KFSR)|author=Rogatyuk, Denis|accessdate=21 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Masip, Antoni Vives||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|02|27}}||{{age|1920|02|27}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Served in auxiliary forces due to an eye problem. Eventually sent to the front and was captured in 1938. |- |Spain||Mateu, Josep Herms||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|01|11}}||{{age|1920|01|11}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Forces
Nationalist Army||Served as an assistant to his father who was a Republican doctor. Captured by Francoist troops in 1939 and pressed into service before the end of the war.{{cite magazine|url=http://locals.esquerra.cat/documents/butlletins/avinyo-el-pedris-30.pdf|magazine=El Pedris|publisher=Esquerra Republicana Avinyó|title=JOSEP HERMS|author=Serra, Isabela|language=Spanish|date=December 2015|issue=30|accessdate=1 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Mercader, Artur Tomàs||{{dts|format=dmy|1918|08|18}}||{{age|1918|08|18}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Enlisted in 1937. Served as a spotter in an artillery unit. Fought at [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]]. Lives in Barcelona.{{cite news|url=https://www.diarimes.com/es/noticias/tarragona/2018/08/17/artur_tomas_celebra_que_vivido_ultimo_siglo_ciudad_tarragona_45044_1091.html|title=Artur Tomàs celebra que ha vivido el último siglo de la ciudad de Tarragona|publisher=Diari Més|author=Gosálbez, Carles|date=17 August 2018}} |- |Spain||Miaja, Fernando Rodríguez||{{dts|format=dmy|1917|08|11}}||{{age|1917|08|11}}||Mexico||Spanish Republican Army||Nephew of [[José Miaja|General Miaja]]. Joined in 1936. Became a lieutenant in an Engineer unit.{{cite news|url=https://www.elmundo.es/cronica/2019/04/01/5c9e54e721efa09f5f8b46ea.html|language=Spanish|title=Miaja, único testigo vivo del hundimiento|publisher=El Mundo|author=Castro-Villacañas, Javier|date=1 April 2019|accessdate=23 April 2019}} |- |Spain||de Miguel Montañés, Miguel||{{dts|format=dmy|1921|06|7}}||{{age|1921|06|7}}||Spain||[[Spanish Republican Air Force]]||Joined the FARE in 1936. Served in a bomber unit. Fought on the [[Aragon Offensive|Aragon front]].{{cite magazine|url=http://www.adar.es/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/ICARO-125.pdf|title=La odisea de los aviadores de la 185 Compañía de Trabajadores Extranjeros|magazine=ICARO|pages=10–13|publisher=La Asociación de Aviadores de la República|date=April 2018|issue=125|author=Orozco, Luis Garrido|accessdate=25 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://cantabrialiberal.com/opinion/miguel-de-miguel-montanes-un-aragones-en-la-fabrica-de-avionetas-de-la-albericia-por-pedro-arce,531998.html|title=Miguel de Miguel Montañés, un aragonés en la fábrica de avionetas de La Albericia por Pedro Arce|language=Spanish|newspaper=Cantabria Liberal|date=20 March 2020|first=Pedro Arce|last=Diaz|accessdate=5 May 2020}}{{cite web|url=http://audiovisual.ua.es/fotoweb/archives/5001-Archivo-de-la-Democracia/ArchivoDemocracia/Asociaci%C3%B3n%20de%20Aviadores%20de%20la%20Rep%C3%BAblica%20(ADAR)/Miguel%20Monta%C3%B1%C3%A9s%2C%20Miguel/01.jpg.info|title=Breve resumen mecanografiado del currículum de Miguel de Miguel Montañés|language=Spanish|date=3 July 2018|publisher=University of Alicante|accessdate=25 April 2019}} |- |Spain||{{Interlanguage link|Mur, Martín Arnal|es|Martín Arnal Mur}}||{{dts|format=dmy|1921|11|12}}||{{age|1921|11|12}}||Spain||[[Confederación Nacional del Trabajo|CNT-FAI]]||Mobilized in 1938. Fought at [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]].{{cite news|url=https://www.publico.es/espana/franquismo-dictadura-relato-vital-maqui-aragon-momento-echar-franco-liberar-espana.html|title=FRANQUISMO DICTADURA El relato vital del último maqui de Aragón: "Era el momento de echar a Franco y liberar a España"|language=Spanish|publisher=Diario Público|author=Bayona, Eduardo|date=15 July 2018|accessdate=24 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Oliveras, Salvador Farrés||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|09|4}}||{{age|1920|09|4}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Enlisted in 1938. Fought at the [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]] and the [[Catalonia Offensive]].{{cite news|url=http://www.elpou.cat/noticia/3271/calaf/van/fer/anar/peu/fins/sanauja/vam/fer/primers/dies/instruccio/amb/escombra/perque/teniem/armes|title="De Calaf, ens van fer anar a peu fins a Sanaüja, on vam fer els primers dies d’instrucció amb una escombra, perquè no teníem armes"|publisher=El Pou Digital|language=Catalan|author=Sardans, Jordi|date=12 November 2018|accessdate=1 September 2019}} |- |Spain||[[Ángeles Flórez Peón|Peón, Ángeles Flórez]]||{{dts|format=dmy|1918|11|17}}||{{age|1918|11|17}}||Spain||Unified Socialist Youth||Joined in 1936. Served as a Cook and a Nurse. Arrested in 1937 following the [[Asturias Offensive|capture of Asturias]].{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/elpais/2018/06/05/mujeres/1528218688_313322.html|title=Maricuela, la última superviviente de la milicia socialista, tiene casi 100 años|language=Spanish|author=Martínez, Gabriella|publisher=El Pais|date=6 June 2018|accessdate=18 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.publico.es/politica/maricuela-ultima-miliciana-socialista-necesitamos-izquierda-unida.html|title=Maricuela, la última miliciana socialista: "Necesitamos una izquierda unida"|language=Spanish|author=Nebot, Marta|publisher=Diario Público|date=5 June 2018|accessdate=18 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://lahoradigital.com/noticia/17524/politica/maricuela-la-ultima-miliciana-cumple-cien-anos.html|title=Maricuela, la última miliciana, cumple cien años|language=Spanish|author=de Bas, Ana|publisher=La Hora Digital|date=16 November 2018|accessdate=18 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Pérez, Julián||1919||||Spain||Unified Socialist Youth
Nationalist Army||Joined Republican forces in 1936. Captured in 1937 and joined Francoist forces to escape staying at a labor camp. Served as a stretcher bearer.{{cite news|url=https://temas.publico.es/supervivientes-memoria/2019/12/23/un-huesped-en-los-campos-de-franco/?doing_wp_cron=1583475125.1589179039001464843750|title=Un huésped en los campos de Franco|language=Spanish|date=23 December 2019|author=Sanza, Alex|publisher=Público|accessdate=5 March 2020}} |- |Spain||Piernas, Juan "Tío Juan Rita" Tudela||{{dts|format=dmy|1912|02|14}}||{{age|1912|02|14}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Served as a cook.{{cite news|url=https://www.lasprovincias.es/sociedad/anos-dando-cante-20180407233803-ntvo.html|title=106 años dando el cante|author=Paniagua, Antonio|date=6 April 2018|publisher=Las Provincias|accessdate=27 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.laverdad.es/murcia/anos-juan-rita-20180214224547-nt.html|title=106 años de Tío Juan Rita|author=Espadas, F.|date=14 February 2018|publisher=La Verdad|accessdate=27 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.laopiniondemurcia.es/municipios/2019/02/14/tio-juan-rita-cumple-107/996880.html|title=El Tío Juan Rita cumple hoy 107 años|date=14 February 2019|publisher=La Opinión de Murcia|accessdate=27 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Piñón, Vicens||{{dts|format=dmy|1918|01|17}}||{{age|1918|01|17}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Joined in 1936. Served as a medic at [[Battle of Belchite (1937)|Belchite]].{{cite web|url=https://interactius.ara.cat/avis-centenaris-catalunya|title=VIDES CENTENÀRIES|author=Vera, Esther|publisher=[[Ara (newspaper)|Ara]]|date=11 September 2018|accessdate=8 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Pons, Andrés||1917||||[[Argentina]]||Spanish Republican Army||Fought at [[Battle of Guadalajara|Guadalajara]]. Became a lieutenant and was captured by Nationalist forces. Spent three years in captivity.{{cite news|url=https://www.cronica.com.ar/info-general/La-increible-historia-de-Andres-sobreviviente-de-la-guerra-civil-espanola-20190706-0035.html|title=La increíble historia de Andrés, sobreviviente de la guerra civil española|language=Spanish|author=Pisapia, Guillermo|publisher=Crónica|date=7 July 2019|accessdate=31 August 2019}} |- |Spain||Pons, Joan/Juan||||||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||"La quinta del biberón" fighter. |- |Spain||Riba, Josep Randé||{{dts|format=dmy|1919|11|07}}||{{age|1919|11|07}}||Spain||International Brigades||Joined the [[Rakosi Battalion]] in 1938. Taken prisoner at [[Battle of the Ebro|Corbera d'Ebre]] in September, 1938.{{cite news|url=https://www.elnacional.cat/ca/cultura/brigades-internacionals-historia-memoria-seminari-ub_317874_102.html|title=La UB recorda les Brigades Internacionals, a 80 anys de la seva retirada|language=Spanish|publisher=El Nacional|author=Nerín, Gustau|date=26 October 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://sidbrint.ub.edu/ca/content/rande-riba-josep|title=RANDÉ RIBA, Josep.|language=Spanish|publisher=University of Barcelona|accessdate=21 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Romero, Juan Romero||{{dts|format=dmy|1919|4|21}}||{{age|1919|4|21}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Joined in 1936. Served in the 33rd Brigade. Fought at [[Battle of Guadarrama|Guadarrama]],[[Battle of Guadalajara|Guadalajara]], [[Battle of Brunete|Brunete]], [[Battle of Teruel|Teruel]], and [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]]. Fled to France but was captured in 1940 and imprisoned. Last Spanish veteran to survive the [[Mauthausen concentration camp]].{{cite web|url=http://deportados.es/romero_historia|title=Juan Romero Romero|publisher=Deportados.es|language=Spanish|accessdate=5 March 2020}}{{cite news|url=https://www.eldiario.es/sociedad/Adios-antepenultimo-superviviente-espanol-concentracion_0_999500176.html|title=Muere a los 101 años Juan Aznar, uno de los últimos españoles que logró sobrevivir al campo nazi de Mauthausen|language=Spanish|date=25 February 2020|publisher=El Diario|author=Hernández, Carlos|accessdate=5 March 2020}} |- |Spain||Ruiz, Rafael Martínez|||{{dts|format=dmy|1914|03|25}}||{{age|1914|03|25}}|||Spain||Unified Socialist Youth||Joined the JSU in 1931. Served in an artillery unit. Lives in Córdoba.{{cite news|url=https://www.eldiario.es/andalucia/siglo-comunismo-primera-persona_0_242875938.html|title=100 años de comunismo con nombre y apellidos|language=Spanish|author=Reina, Carmen|date=26 March 2014|publisher=eldiario.es|accessdate=27 April 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.diariocordoba.com/noticias/contraportada/chaval-103-anos_1177442.html|title=Un ‘chaval’ de 103 años|author=Raya, M. J.|publisher=Diario Córdoba|language=Spanish|accessdate=27 April 2019}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mundoobrero.es/pl.php?id=7969|title=Rafael Martínez Ruiz cumple 104 años|date=10 May 2018|author=Miranda, Alba Doblas|publisher=Mundo Obrero|accessdate=27 April 2019}} |- |Spain||Sala, Josep||1919||||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||"La quinta del biberón" fighter. Called to service in March 1938.{{cite news|url=https://www.eldiario.es/catalunya/Josep-Sala-superviviente-concentracion-franquista_0_909559492.html|title=Josep Sala, superviviente de los campos de concentración franquistas: "No éramos ni siquiera un número, no éramos nada"|language=Spanish|author=Pareja, Pol|date=14 June 2019|publisher=El Diario|accessdate=4 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Toledo, Salvador||{{dts|format=dmy|1919|04|12}}||{{age|1919|04|12}}||Spain||[[Guardia de Asalto|Spanish Republican Assault Guard]]||Joined in 1936. Served for three years. Sent to Morocco after the war. Lives in Badajoz.{{cite news|url=https://www.hoy.es/extremadura/acabo-guerra-civil-20190401003503-ntvo.html|title="El día que acabó la guerra civil empezó el hambre"|language=Spanish|author=Martín, José M.|publisher=Hoy|date=1 April 2019|accessdate=8 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Torras, Jaume Navarro||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|02|02}}||{{age|1920|02|02}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Army||Called to service in 1938. Served at [[Battle of the Segre|Segre]] and [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]].{{cite news|url=https://www.regio7.cat/manresa/2018/12/01/cridaven-disparen-mare-volen-matari/513206.html|title="Cridaven 'ens disparen, mare, ens volen matar!',i va ser una desfeta"|language=Spanish|publisher=Regio7|author=Mañé, Pepa|date=30 November 2018|accessdate=1 September 2019}} |- |Spain||{{Interlanguage link|Vivancos, Eduardo|es|Eduardo Vivancos}}||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|09|19}}||{{age|1920|09|19}}||Canada||Spanish Republican Army||[[Esperanto|Esperantist]], served with the [[26th Division (Spain)]].{{cite web|last1=Botella|first1=Antonio Marco|title=Eduardo Vivancos (in Esperanto)|url=https://sites.google.com/site/fratecoamb/biografioj/eduardo-vivancos}} |- |} ==Nationalist forces – 10 veterans== {| cellpadding=2 cellspacing=0 border=1 style="border-collapse:collapse; border: 1px #555 solid;" class="sortable" |- bgcolor="#ccccff" !colspan=1 width="10%"|Nationality !colspan=1 width="14%"|Name !colspan=1 width="12%"|Date of Birth !colspan=1 width="5%"|Age !colspan=1 width="10%"|Residence !colspan=1 width="16%"|Force served !colspan=1 width="43%"|Notes |- |- |Spain||Alpuin, Pedro Placeres||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|06|29}}||{{age|1920|06|29}}||Spain||[[Francoist Spain#Armed forces|Nationalist Army]]||Enlisted in 1936. Served at [[Aragon Offensive|Aragon]]. Left service in 1941. Lives on the Canary Islands.{{cite news|url=https://www.diariodelanzarote.com/noticia/pedro-placeres-el-comercio-mala-y-el-siglo-xx|title=Pedro Placeres: el comercio, Mala y el Siglo XX|language=Spanish|publisher=Diario de Lanzarote|date=19 October 2016|author=García, Saúl|accessdate=8 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Casalderrey, José Pérez||{{dts|format=dmy|1919|08|01}}||{{age|1919|08|01}}||Spain||Nationalist Army||Enlisted in 1936. Fought at [[Asturias Offensive|Asturias]], [[Battle of Teruel|Teruel]], [[Aragon Offensive|Aragon]], and [[Cartagena uprising|Cartagena]].{{cite news|url=https://www.farodevigo.es/portada-arousa/2019/01/12/18-anos-pusieron-fusil-guerra/2031735.html|title="Con 18 años me pusieron un fusil y me fui a la Guerra"|language=Spanish|author=López, María|publisher=Faro de Vigo|date=12 January 2019|accessdate=8 September 2019}} |- |Spain||{{Interlanguage link|de Rábago, Andrés Díaz|gl|Andrés Díaz de Rábago}}||{{dts|format=dmy|1917|10|17}}||{{age|1917|10|17}}||Taiwan||Nationalist Army|| |- |Spain||López, José López||1916||||Spain||Nationalist Army||Joined in 1936. Fought at the [[Battle of the Ebro|Ebro]]. Joined the [[Blue Division]] in 1942 and later served in Russia.{{cite news|url=https://www.granadahoy.com/granada/superviviente-guerra-civil-mundial-division-azul_0_1320168405.html|title=José López López, el último divisionario azul|language=Spanish|date=20 January 2019|author=Cárdenas, Andrés|publisher=Granada Hoy|accessdate=1 August 2019}} |- |Italy||Maiorano, Domenico||{{dts|format=dmy|1916|07|11}}||{{age|1916|07|11}}||Italy||[[Regia Marina|Italian Royal Navy]]||Enlisted as a volunteer in 1937.{{cite news|url=https://quotidianodifoggia.it/domenico-maiorano-compie-103-anni-e-cerca-ancora-moglie/|title=Domenico Maiorano compie 103 anni e cerca ancora moglie|language=Italian|date=16 July 2019|author=Laganella, Giuseppe|publisher=Quotidiano di Foggia|accessdate=7 September 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://abitarearoma.it/domenico-maiorano-compiuto-100-anni/|title=Domenico Maiorano ha compiuto 100 anni|language=Italian|publisher=Abitare a Roma|date=20 July 2016|author=Laganella, Giuseppe|accessdate=7 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Mateu, Josep Herms||{{dts|format=dmy|1920|01|11}}||{{age|1920|01|11}}||Spain||Spanish Republican Forces
Nationalist Army||Served as an assistant to his father who was a Republican doctor. Captured by Francoist troops in 1939 and pressed into service before the end of the war.{{cite magazine|url=http://locals.esquerra.cat/documents/butlletins/avinyo-el-pedris-30.pdf|magazine=El Pedris|publisher=Esquerra Republicana Avinyó|title=JOSEP HERMS|author=Serra, Isabela|language=Spanish|date=December 2015|issue=30|accessdate=1 September 2019}} |- |Spain||Olmo, José Fernández||{{dts|format=dmy|1919|03|11}}||{{age|1919|03|11}}||Spain||Nationalist Army||Mobalized at 18 years old. Had two brothers in Republican forces. Fought at Madrid and Catalonia. |- |Spain||Pérez, Julián||1919||||Spain||Unified Socialist Youth
Nationalist Army||Joined Republican forces in 1936. Captured in 1937 and joined Francoist forces to escape staying at a labor camp. Served as a stretcher bearer.{{cite news|url=https://temas.publico.es/supervivientes-memoria/2019/12/23/un-huesped-en-los-campos-de-franco/?doing_wp_cron=1583475125.1589179039001464843750|title=Un huésped en los campos de Franco|language=Spanish|date=23 December 2019|author=Sanza, Alex|publisher=Público|accessdate=5 March 2020}} |- |Spain||Revesado, Jesús||1918||||Spain||Nationalist Army||Joined at 18 years old. Served in the 13th Battalion. Lives in Salamanca.{{cite news|url=https://www.dgratisdigital.com/actualidad/salamanca-centenarios-usera/|title=La Salamanca del siglo XX narrada por dos centenarios|language=Spanish|date=9 November 2019|publisher=DGratis Salamanca|accessdate=5 March 2020}} |- |Italy||Vangeli, Quinto||{{dts|format=dmy|1919|09|01}}||{{age|1919|09|01}}||Italy||Italian Royal Navy||Volunteered for service between 1938 and 1939. Served on the destroyer [[Freccia-class destroyer|''Freccia'']].{{cite news|url=https://ecodellalunigiana.it/2019/09/01/quinto-compie-100-anni-grande-festa-a-vezzanello-nel-comune-di-fivizzano/|title=Quinto compie 100 anni, grande festa a Vezzanello nel comune di Fivizzano|author=Remaggi, Diego|date=1 September 2019|language=Italian|publisher=Eco Della Lunigiana|accessdate=7 September 2019}} |- |} ==See also== *[[List of last surviving veterans of military insurgencies and wars]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20040830083601/http://www.alba-valb.org/ Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives] *[http://www.international-brigades.org.uk/ International Brigade Memorial Trust] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20091028112140/http://www.geocities.com/irelandscw Ireland and the Spanish Civil War] *[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7420469.stm Last surviving Spanish Civil War Anarchist veteran] *[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/wales/3680687.stm Last surviving Spanish Civil War veteran from Wales] *[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/northern_ireland/3908529.stm Surviving Spanish Civil War veterans meet again] *[https://books.google.com/books?id=WWK2QW5HXaIC&pg=PA1960&dq=matti+mattson#v=onepage&q=&f=false The Front Lines of Social Change: Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade] {{Longevity}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Spanish Civil War, List Of Surviving Veterans Of The}} [[Category:Lists of military personnel]] [[Category:Spanish Civil War-related lists|Surviving Veterans]] [[Category:People of the Spanish Civil War|Surviving]] [[Category:Veterans of the Spanish Civil War|Surviving]] [[Category:Lists of military veterans]] [[Category:Lists of Spanish military personnel]] [[Category:Lists of living people]] [[Category:Lists of survivors]] [[Category:Last living survivors]]
